title: Inventur Datenübertrabung: MDE-Gerät wird von Kasse nicht erkannt
text: Wenn das MDE-Gerät zum Start einer Inventur nicht richtig mit der Kasse verbunden ist, können Sie folgende Schritte vornehmen: 1. Öffnen Sie "Funktion" in der Kasse 2. Klicken Sie anschließend auf System -> Kassenparameter 3. Klicken Sie anschließend auf "Alle Parameter" 4. Geben Sie im Suchfeld "SvMDeComPort" ein und bestätigen Sie mit der Eingabetaste (Enter) 5. Finde Sie den Parameter anhand den Werten "Typ" und "Dat" und klicken Sie diesen an 6. Geben Sie im Eingabefeld rechts oben die richtige ComPort Nummer ein Die richtige ComPort Nummer finden Sie im Windows Gerätemanager: - Drücken Sie die Tastenkombination "Windows-Logo" + "x" - Klicken Sie auf "Geräte-Manager" - Klicken Sie per Doppelklick auf "Anschlüsse" - Nun sehen Sie unter welchem ComPort das MDE-Gerät mit dem Namen "Silicon Labs..." angeschlossen ist. Wenn Sie sich unsicher sind, stecken Sie das MDE-Gerät aus und anschließend wieder ein und beobachten Sie welcher ComPort im Geräte-Manager verschwindet und wieder auftaucht. Handelt es sich beispielsweise wie im folgenden Screenshot um COM7, so müssen Sie im Eingabefeld in der Kasse (wie oben beschrieben) die Zahl "7" ein. Klicken Sie nach Eingabe der richtigen ComPort Nummer in der Kasse auf "OK" und anschließend auf "Speichern" Die Kasse startet sich nun automatisch neu und sollte das MDE-Gerät nun erkennen. Kontaktieren Sie den K3 Support, falls es dennoch nicht funktioniert.

title: Cowis cash registers manual
text: Here you can download the manual for using the Cowiskasse to view the basic functions

title: Is it possible to change an end of day report
text: Sometimes you make a mistake when closing the day. Once the daily closing is printed, NO change is possible.

title: Cowiskasse does not start - possibly the SQL server is not running
text: If Cowiskasse does not start on the cash register PC and a similar message (Figure 1) appears, the cause is usually a non-started SQL server on the cash register PC. - Open the Windows services - look for the SQLServer service with the appropriate name (usually Cowis, Cowiskasse orSQLEXPRESS) - right click on the found service and "start" it - start Cowiskasse and it should work

title: An expense document was entered incorrectly at the cash register
text: Regardless of whether an expense receipt has been entered twice at the cowis cash register, or with an incorrect amount, the solution is usually the INPUT REPORT . Directly below the button for the expense receipt at the cash register is the button for the deposit receipt. This is used to deposit money into the cash register.

title: Handscanner: Scannen von Waren funktioniert nicht
text: Wenn der Handscanner nicht funktioniert, können Sie folgenden Schritten folgen: 1. Stecken Sie das Kabel des Scanners für 30 Sekunden aus und reinigen Sie das Glas des Scanners mit einem trockenen Tuch. 2. Stecken Sie das Kabel wieder ein 3. Starten Sie den PC neu 4. Versuchen Sie nun, eine Ware zu scannen Falls es immer noch nicht funktioniert, können Sie versuchen das Kabel auszutauschen, sofern Sie ein Ersatzkabel zugänglich haben. Andernfalls können Sie den K3 Support kontaktieren.

title: How can I change texts on the receipt
text: Wenn individuelle Texte auf dem Kassenbon gewünscht sind, wie "Schöne Weihnachten" oder "Frohe Ostern" kann man das PRO Kasse manuell einstellen: 1. Zuerst am besten eine Sicherung der vorhandenen Formulare durchführen: Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern Auslagern Alle OK Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT Speichern Formulare sind gesichert 2. Anschließend die Formulare ändern: Kasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formular-Verwaltung Formular Verkauf anklicken Formular klicken Editor öffnet sich Text an gewünschter Stelle einfügen Schließen Kreuz und Frage nach Speichern mit Ja beantworten

title: Receipt - cancel
text: To cancel a receipt, the receipt has to be from the same day and it can only be done before cash closing. On the POS: Funktion -> Erweitert -> Beleg stonieren -> find receipt and click OK Once the receipt has been cancled, it cannot be reactivated. If the customer wants to cancel a receipt after cash closing, this cannot be done. The sale has to be treated as a return.

title: Error message on the Cowiskasse “Fiskaly TSE failed”
text: According to German law, your Cowiskassen software has a so-called “technical security device” (TSE for short). You can read what this means in this external link Erläuterung zur TSE The basic requirement for the TSE signing unit to function properly is an internet connection. If you receive a message at the Cowis checkout like the one in the following picture: This means that there is a malfunction from your cash register computer to the TSE signing office. This may be caused by: - YOUR internet failure - Internet failure in your city - Malfunction on the part of the FISKALY TSE signing unit All of these disruptions have primarily nothing to do with the Cowiskasse. After the corresponding malfunction has been eliminated, the TSE signing unit returns to its normal status. You can check whether there is a problem with FISKALY TSE here: FISKALY TSE STATUS

title: Connecting PayTerminal to CowisKasse
text: The only way to connect a PayTerminal with Cowiskasse is the ZVT with a serial connection cable on the RS-232 interface. Cowiskasse do not support a connection to the POS via IP or any other different way than serial

title: Create new reduction reason
text: If you want to create a new button for a reduction reason in the cash register, you must do this in merchandise management: Open the area Kassenabschlüsse->Datei->Reduzierungsgründe->Neu Here you can create a new reduction reason. If you wish, you can select status 1 when creating the reduction reason. This means that the following will NOT be printed on the receipt: "Reduced goods are excluded from exchange." With the next data exchange, the new reduction reason is then available as a "button" in the register

title: Auswahl
text: Auswahl mitgeben Wenn Sie einem Kunden Ware zur Auswahl mitgeben ist folgendes zu tun: • Etiketten der entsprechenden Artikel einscannen • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ und wählen Sie im Anschluss die Zahlart „Auswahl“ aus Hinweis: Im Auslieferungszustand der C!Touch Kasse können Auswahlen nur mitgegeben werden, wenn zuvor ein Kunde gewählt wurde. Auswahl zurücknehmen / verkaufen Wenn der Kunde die mitgenommene Ware zurückbringt, bzw. kaufen möchte, gibt es verschiedene Möglichkeiten die Auswahl aufzurufen: • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Kunde“ und wählen Sie den entsprechenden Kunden aus • Wenn es von dem Kunden „offene Auswahlen“ gibt, erscheint der Button „Auswahl“ neben dem Kunden- Adressfeld (s. Abb.) • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Auswahl“ • Sie können nun im Fenster „Auswahl zurück“ (s. Abb.) die Auswahlbeleg-Nummer eintippen und mit Button „OK“ bestätigen oder • auf den Button „Auswahlen des Kunden“ tippen Abb. Auswahl zurück • In beiden Fällen erscheint das folgende Fenster, mit dem Unterschied, dass bei der direkten Eingabe der Auswahlbeleg-Nummer nur diese Auswahl erscheint Tippen Sie nun auf die Buttons „Verkaufen“ und/oder „Zurück“, je nachdem was der Kunde zurückbringen bzw. kaufen möchte, und anschließend auf „OK“ • Positionen, bei denen weder „Verkaufen“ noch „Zurück“ angetippt wurde, bleiben weiterhin in Auswahl • Wenn ein oder mehrere Artikel aus der Auswahl verkauft werden, können Sie den Verkaufsvorgang abschließen indem Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ tippen • Wenn die Auswahl nur zurück gegeben wird, kommt die folgende Abfrage: • Tippen Sie auf „Ja“ und es wird ein Beleg der zurückgebrachten Ware ausgedruckt Hinweis: Sie können auch eine Auswahl aufrufen, indem Sie auf den Button „Funktion“ tippen und innerhalb der Registerkarte „Allgemein“ die „Auswahl-Verwaltung“ auswählen. Danach erhalten Sie, wie auf der vorherigen Seite abgebildet, das Fenster „Auswahl zurück“.

title: Anzahlung
text: Eine Anzahlung ist möglich indem Sie einen Kredit vergeben 1. Kunden erfassen 2. Gewünschtes Teil (Teile) einscannen 3. Klicken Sie auf bezahlen 4. Höhe der Anzahlung erfassen (in dem Beispiel 135,00 Euro bar), es kann aber auch jede andere Zahlart gewählt werden 5. Rest auf Zahlart Kredit erfassen Verkauf mit OK abschließen Es kommen Belege raus, Quittung und Kreditbeleg (im Standardlayout) Wenn die Kundin kommt um den Kredit zu bezahlen: 1. Kundin aufrufen 2. Position wählen Kredit bezahlen wählen Korrekten Kredit wählen Anklicken und mit OK in die Verkaufsposition übernehmen Abwicklung wie gewohnt -> bezahlen -> Zahlung durchführen

title: How do I handle a deposit at the Cowis checkout?
text: If I want a deposit from the customer, be it for an individual order or for any other reason, the only option at the Cowis checkout is to sell a gift voucher. It is a good idea to use the text "Deposit for XXX" as a comment.

title: Create sellers for the Cowiskasse
text: Sellers are created in the Cowis.Net back office and then transferred to the cash register using the regular data exchange. First open the "Addresses" area and either open an existing contact or create a new contact via "New". An address becomes an employee address by activating the "Employee" checkbox. If the address should also be sent to the cash register as a salesperson, switch to the "Employee" tab Here you assign a salesperson number (you CANNOT create a salesperson number in the possible drop-down menu, this drop-down is only to show you which salesperson numbers have already been assigned) Then you define the main branch of this salesperson, assign the authorization group and determine what should be printed on the cash register receipt as "You were served .......... This process is completed by saving.

title: TSE Info Export
text: If you need POS data for a certain period for the tax department, do as follows: Open POS -> Funktion -> TSE -> Export Set start date (Startdatum) and end date (Enddatum) and click OK The data will be exported to the indicated folder (usually Cowis/CowisKasse into a folder called TSE Export.

title: Identification of the seller at the Cowis cash register
text: Normally, the basic setting of the Cowis cash register is such that all sellers are displayed on the overview screen. Access can be protected by a password. (in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net merchandise management system) However, there is also the option of processing identification using a barcode (or entering a numerical code) In the parameters for the Cowis cash register in the Cowis.Net back office, there is the parameter "KaSvVerkIdent". This controls the type of seller identification at the Cowis cash register. If you change this parameter and set it to "1", the login screen at the Cowis cash register looks like this: If you then enter either a barcode in plain text or a number (like 02543236 here) in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net back office, the seller can use this at the cash register can access the cash register using this number or card barcode. This is how it is intended to be handled

title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them

title: Recording working hours in Cowiskasse
text: Working hours and breaks can be recorded in the Cowiskasse. Corrections are NOT possible in the Cowiskasse. To carry out the recording, the seller logs in to the cash register Then select the function The Time Recording button can be found on the Advanced tab Once selected, you must select your seller name again After identification, the window for recording the type of time recording opens. Cowiskasse differentiates between "coming" and "going" When you have arrived for work, press "coming" The coming entry is set Then press close Break When you go on a break, you normally select going So you go the same way again: Function -> Advanced -> Time recording (in this example, the employee worked for 2 minutes before going on a break) When you return from the break, you obviously have to book coming again, so the route is again Function -> Advanced -> Time Recording End of work When you have finished work or your shift is over, use the going function in time recording one last time Function -> Advanced -> Time recording This concludes the working day. You can of course make as many coming and going bookings on one day as you like. Cowiskasse is not limited to a number here. Likewise, the way in which the coming and going bookings are made is generally specified by your employer. The evaluation of working hours takes place in the Cowis.Net back office

title: Cowiskasse does not start, an error message appears
text: Good to know: The Cowiskasse absolutely requires the so-called SQL server from Microsoft to be used. This is a program from Microsoft that manages all of your Cowiskasse data. The installation and setup is carried out by DdD. The SQL server usually always starts automatically and does not cause any problems. (You will notice the restriction) In certain situations it may happen that the SQL server has not yet started, but the Cowiskasse already wants to access it, in which case you will receive a message like this: You can now try to get the SQL server to start before the Cowiskasse needs it by restarting the cash register computer, or you can use this short "How do I help myself?" You need the local service operator of the Windows operating system: You click on the Windows start symbol (this can look like Windows 10, or be the well-known Windows 7 "ball"), you can also press the Windows symbol on your keyboard. Now you can simply type in the word "Services". (Basically you could also write "Dienste", but since there is a possibility that you have an English operating system, "Dienste" would not help you, whereas the German operating system can handle both "Dienste" and "Services".) The "tree" opens, which shows you the program with the highest match in the first place, this should be Dienste (or Services). You open this program by clicking on it A new window opens with the title "Services" (or Services) Now scroll with the scroll bar on the right until you get to the letter S There you look for an entry that contains the word "SQL Server". Usually followed by the word "COWIS" or "COWISKASSE", i.e. "SQL Server COWIS" or "SQL SERVER COWISKASSE". There will (most likely) be nothing in the "Status" column and "automatic" in the startup type column. This means that the SQL Server should "actually" start automatically but is not currently running. To start the SQL Server, click on the entry once with the left mouse button so that it is highlighted in blue. Now click on "start" in the top left corner In the best case, the status has changed to "running" and you can close the window and then start your Cowiskasse normally again. If you are unsure, it is always a good choice to contact support if possible.

title: Printjob deleted in Cowis still prints
text: If you have deleted a printjob in Cowis, but it still keeps printing, that means that the print queue in Windows has not been deleted. You have two ways to correct this problem. 1. You can shut down your PC and your printer, leave them off for 30 seconds, and restart both. That should clear the print queue. 2. Empty the print queue in Windows for your specific printer. Windows 11: 1. Search for printers and scanners 2. Double click the printer name 3. Open the print queue 4. Delete Windows 10: 1. Search for printes and scanners 2. Click on the printer name 3. Click Open Queue 4. Click Printer 5. Click Cancel All Documents Windows 7: 1. Click Start 2. Click Devices and Printers 3. Double click on the printer name 4. Click Printer 5. Click Cancel all Documents

title: POS did not save receipt
text: If the POS does not save a receipt but the card terminal prints the receipt, the sale must be repeated, but you first need to detach the card terminal in Cowis POS. Click on Funktion 1. System 2. KassenParameter 3. Alle Parameter 4. PinpadProdukt (in this case it will be on 4 = ZVT (Standard)) Change it to 0 = Inaktiv. 5. Speichern The POS will restart, the customer can now repeat the sale and use Pin-Pad as payment. Once the receipt has been printed, repeat the above process and set the PinpadProdukt back to 4 = ZVT (Standard). The POS will restart again and the sale has now been saved.

title: What is the GPSR?
text: The new EU-wide Product Safety Regulation (also GPSR) will come into force on December 13, 2024. This will impose a number of obligations on retailers who operate an online shop. You as a retailer are responsible for implementing the GPSR in your online shop; we as the provider of merchandise management and, if applicable, your online shop can support you with technical means. If you are not sure how to implement the GPSR, seek legal advice! We cannot give you legally secure information. The GPSR implementation can be complex for you as a retailer. The GPSR only affects products that are put into circulation after December 13, 2024, at least that is OUR knowledge. For you, this would mean that you would not have to revise the products you have offered so far. (This is not a legally binding technical statement) The help articles in the directory describe measures that will help you use Cowis appropriately to support implementation.

title: Published Cowis News (11/18/2024)
text: Dear customers, the new General Product Safety Regulation (GPSR) of the European Union will come into force on December 13, 2024. This regulation will significantly tighten the product safety requirements for all non-food products sold on the EU market. As a provider of a merchandise management system, we would like to draw your attention to the upcoming changes and help you to be prepared in good time. What does the GPSR mean for retailers and manufacturers? Product safety obligations: Products must meet the new requirements of the GPSR before they can be sold. Extended information obligations: Warnings and safety information must be available in the respective national languages of the EU member states. Traceable supply chains: The traceability of products must be guaranteed in order to be able to react quickly to safety problems. Sanctions for violations: Companies that do not meet the requirements must expect stricter controls and potential penalties. How COWIS can support you With COWIS you can efficiently ensure compliance with the new regulations: Product data management: Centrally manage all safety-relevant information and documentation. Our tip for you: If you are a COWIS DdD eShop customer, you have the option of storing all manufacturer-relevant information in the shop in the form of a CSV file. If necessary, please contact Mr. Maretzke directly at markus.maretzke@k3btg.com. He will support you with this. (This service may be subject to a fee and is calculated depending on the effort involved). Multilingual integration: Store the required warnings and safety information for all EU languages in your system. Our tip for you: Actively use CHAT GPT to quickly and easily translate the manufacturer-relevant information into all necessary languages. Traceability: Make sure that the supply chain of your products is fully documented in order to meet legal requirements. Act in good time! The GPSR brings with it numerous changes that require careful preparation. We would be happy to help you adapt your processes accordingly and be optimally prepared for the new regulations. We are available at any time for further information or individual advice. Best regards, Your DdD COWIS team

title: Maintaining the manufacturer ID in the addresses
text: You need a current Cowis UPDate. This is how you read an update into Cowis Since the GPSR requires the specification of a manufacturer for articles, and the supplier is not always the manufacturer, we had to create a new feature in the addresses area. Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the internet search functions to find out how a manufacturer defines itself. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this.) You will first notice this in the list layer of addresses. If you create a new manufacturer address, you can define whether this is a pure manufacturer address by activating the manufacturer checkbox. The following applies to pure manufacturer addresses: Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this. If you would like to edit an existing supplier address in order to also activate the manufacturer checkbox, select the address to be changed with Change (or F7), activate the manufacturer checkbox by clicking on the checkbox with the mouse and save the change by either pressing F2 or clicking the Save button with the mouse. change selected address click on the checkbox with the mouse and activate it Save the change with F2 or with the Save symbol As it is possible that all of your suppliers are manufacturers at the same time, there will be a follow-up update that makes it possible to automatically activate the checkbox for marked addresses. (However, there will be no check to see whether you have marked customer, employee or supplier addresses, you must be careful here) If you have only maintained your supplier addresses rudimentarily in the past, it is high time to complete all the missing information so that the address also meets the GPSR requirements. Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you any legally binding information on this.)

title: Creating the article property ManufacturerAddressId
text: You need a current Cowis update This is how you load a Cowis update In the items section, you must first create a new item property. You do this as follows In your Cowis.Net back office inventory management system, go to the items section Next, go to Settings In the menu that opens, go to Standard settings and then select the item "Configuration properties (keywords)" Depending on how many properties you have already defined, the list displayed will be longer or shorter. You now need to create the new keyword field "ManufacturerArdId" To do this, click on NEW as usual in Cowis.Net or press F5 An empty line is created, the cursor is automatically in the Type field Press F9 (for the list of predefined properties) or use the drop-down menu. Scroll down until you get to the last entry, this has the number 25 and is ManufacturerAdrID Select this with OK or double-click with the mouse, the entry will be added to the list of configured properties. Leave the checkboxes for "Active" and "Visible in article" active (do not change them) We also strongly advise against changing the suggested article sorting. Or to put it more clearly: Leave the sorting order as the program suggests. You can now save this by clicking OK or F2. The entry is now in the list Exit the window for the configuration properties with OK or Back or Close X You can find out how to store the ManufacturerAdrID for an article here:

title: Entering the manufacturer address ID for a new article
text: After you have learned here "Creating the article property ManufacturerAddressId" how to create the property field for the manufacturer address ID in the article, you will now learn how to insert the manufacturer address ID into a new article. When you create a new item, you will find the area with item properties on the "Additional information" tab. The "Manufacturer address ID" property is displayed here. On the "Manufacturer address ID" article property, you can use the dropdown menu or the F9 key to call up a list of all the manufacturers that have been created. You select the appropriate manufacturer for this article with OK or a double click In the window that opens, click OK or press Enter and the selected entry is transferred to the article property You can now save your article

title: Storing the manufacturer address ID for existing articles
text: If you want to store the manufacturer address ID for an individual article, call up the article using Change and store the appropriate manufacturer address ID. As this process is no different from other processes when you subsequently change an article property, we will not go into this explicitly here. You can also store a manufacturer address ID for several marked articles. This is done using the standard editing function "edit marked articles". First, mark all articles to which you want to assign a specific manufacturer address ID. (in this example, the supplier "Zo-Zi") You can also make selections for articles that are only assigned to the online shop (see selection "belong to platform") Then go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked articles Select Assign article property Under "How should it be changed": Instead of old entry You can select this from the drop-down menu Then in the "Keyword" area select any of the 4 predefined keyword fields using the drop-down menu and select the entry "ManufacturerAdrID". You activate the "Change" checkbox and either select the manufacturer's address ID that matches the marked articles from the drop-down menu under Value or enter the address ID manually. Finally, click on Execute You will receive a message window that the property has been changed for X articles. Confirm this message with OK, then you will be back in the original window You can close this window with Cancel or exit by closing X The check shows that the manufacturer address ID is now stored in the articles. As always: If you are unsure, contact support

title: Activate manufacturer address ID collectively
text: You need the latest Cowis.Net UPDate (at least 6.4.60 from December 1st, 2024) This is how you load a Cowis update If you want to activate the checkbox for the manufacturer for several suppliers, you can now do this in the address area. IMPORTANT: Cowis does not check whether the addresses you have marked are supplier addresses. You mark the supplier addresses you want to edit in the addresses area. In the example, 6 addresses of suppliers are marked You go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked addresses There you select "Supplier = Manufacturer" You click OK If you have a cash register connection, this question appears, here you can press YES Cowis asks you whether you want to delete the marking of the addresses Yes or No (If you click no, the changed addresses remain marked and you can more easily check whether the "Manufacturer" checkbox has been activated) You can see that the manufacturer checkbox is activated. You can now maintain the manufacturer ID in the articles. The manufacturer's address ID is now identical to the supplier's address ID Storing the manufacturer address ID for existing articles Don't forget to unmark the addresses (CTRL+e) And as always: If you are unsure, ask support.

title: ManufacturerAdrID in the online shop
text: Please contact Mr. Maretzke by email to display the manufacturer Markus.Maretzke@k3btg.com

title: Cowis Knowledge Base
text: There is a special external Cowis knowledgebase where you might want to search for answers before asking Support: Cowis Knowledge Database

title: Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation) TSE
text: Please find out what legal form your company has and have this information ready. Here is a list of the available legal forms. We cannot help you here. We (you) also need your 13-digit tax number. You can calculate this using this link. Calculating a 13-digit tax number If you wish, you can enter both the legal form and the 13-digit tax number in the Cowis.Net back office master data. You can find out how and where to do this in this help article. Enter the legal form and the 13-digit tax number
subcategory: TSE  - Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation)

title: Enter the legal form and the 13-digit tax number
text: If you have installed the necessary update (at least version 6.4.60 [250303] dated April 8, 2025) of the Cowis.Net Back Office ERP system, you can prepare the registration of your cash registers with the tax office yourself. To do this, go to the Cash Register Closings section. Then go to Settings and select the lowest option: All You are now in the Cowis Settings Enter the letters "tse" (upper or lower case) in the search field. You will see two parameters. The relevant parameter is the one named "KaTseFiskaly." Click on it once, and the parameter will be highlighted in blue. Now click on the three dots in the right-hand area of the window. The parameter set for the TSE settings will open. Now, in the Legal Form drop-down menu, select the appropriate legal form for your company (e.g., a civil law partnership). Next, enter your 13-digit tax number in the corresponding field. A tax number will already be included here; the format was unimportant at the time the TSE was set up, i.e. the format of the tax number that is now entered can vary and look like "123/00125/4565" or "123 00125 4565". Since the tax office report requires a specific format, you can calculate the existing tax number using the link displayed above the field. Clicking this link will open a page in your internet browser: tax number Select your federal state and enter your tax number, which is stored in Cowis. Then click "Calculate." You will receive a 13-digit tax number, which you then enter in the Tax Number field in Cowis.Net. Then click OK to save it in the Cowis database. As always: IF YOU ARE UNSURE, ask support!!
subcategory: TSE  - Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation)

title: Alternative Delivery Address
text: To make sure that a new (alternate) Adress is available, make certain that the Filed Anschrift ? Contains an L (stands for Delivery Adresss) Click on Address Choose the address, then click Ändern (Change) No matter if it contains data or not, click Bearbeiten (Edit) Either click Neu (New) or choose the Address and click Ändern (Change) Fill in everything and then click on the arrow next to Anschrift ?, if it does not display an L Click OK three times, then Speichern (Save)

title: Delete voucher
text: If you want to delete a voucher manually, you can do this in the Cowis.Net inventory management (the back office) You go into cash accounts Select File -> Vouchers -> Open Vouchers Always set the UNTIL date very generously, e.g. until 2035 You can search by number This search can also be partially qualified, i.e. you can, for example, search for part of the voucher number Once you have found the voucher, click on it, select Delete, confirm the question whether you really want to delete with Yes and confirm the reason for the change with OK

title: Find articles only on the basis of an EAN or cowis internal EAN
text: To find an article for which you have only an EAN or a cowis internal EAN, you go to - Article area - extras - direct positioning with scanner or use the F11 key in the article area

title: How to export addresses from Cowis.Net
text: The first approach is always to think about what you want to export and to create a selection of the existing addresses. The topic of selections is explained in another article. We therefore assume that you have successfully selected the desired addresses from all of your addresses. The next step is to mark the addresses. Due to the GDPR, customer addresses are shown here in encrypted form. Now go to Tools -> Data Export Depending on the program level of your license, the window may offer more or fewer export options, but this is generally irrelevant. Which export function you choose is your choice, we will go into 2 export functions here, “Comma as separator” and “Cowis standard export”. Comma as separator: So you select the item “Comma as separator” and click OK In this window you select which information from the addresses you want to export. (The topic of "mask" is explained in another article) For example, if you would like to have telephone numbers or email addresses exported in addition to the basic address data such as name, street and city, activate the check box Important: As soon as you have activated a check box for export, Cowis offers you another check box in the column behind it. The heading of the column is "Use Std" which means "Use Standard". ACTIVATE this if you want Cowis to use the standard of the respective data record, otherwise the program will ask you which data record you want to export for EVERY address. So this is what the mask should look like. Now you determine the path and file name of the export file. What you name the file and where you store it is up to you. Cowis always suggests the storage location in the export directory. It is important that the .TXT file extension remains present. If the export was successful, you will receive a message that you can confirm with OK. Under certain circumstances, Cowis will open an error log for you. Here you can see if addresses do not have the export feature you want. You can rework these addresses. Then deselect the addresses and cancel the selection.

title: How to select in addresses
text: As you know, the addresses section of the Cowis.Net merchandise management contains all addresses that have something to do with Cowis.Net and the Cowiskasse. This includes suppliers, employees and customers. You already know that you can quickly identify them using the display K (customer), L (supplier) and M (employee). Let's assume that you now want to select a specific area from all of your addresses. For our example, it doesn't matter what it's about, you just want to get the first impression of how it works. You now want to select all suppliers from postal code area 2. The postcode area 2 contains 20000 to 29999 (whether this postcode really exists is irrelevant). You open the selection with F3 or clicking on the funnel button. You select "J" in the SUPPLIER area using the drop-down menu or enter a capital J manually. Enter 2* in the zip code field. What does that mean? The star stands as a placeholder of any length. You click OK and the result will be a list of all suppliers from postal code area 2

title: Mark and edit articles
text: You have several options for marking articles Space+STRG Individual items can be selected or deselected using the "Space+CTRL" key. Select item within the item detail view Select or deselect items within the item detail view using the shortcut "Ctrl + spacebar". Mark articles with the mouse Drag the mouse up or down in the gray column on the left and the items will be marked accordingly. Mark article with CTRL+mouse Hold down the "CTRL" key and click with the mouse on an item to select or deselect it. Mark article with SHIFT+mouse Click on the first item you want to select. Hold down the SHIFT key and click on the last item. All items in between are now highlighted. Select item via the menu To do this, go to "Datensatz\Markieren". Here there are also many special functions such as "Artikel mit Bestand markieren" or "Markieren mit Maske". Special functions such as Mit Artikel-Beschreibungstext"(Datensatz\Markieren\Mit Sonderfunktion\Mit Artikel-Texte) are also possible. Here you can make a pre-selection of all article texts in the respective languages. This gives you an even more precise selection of the articles so that you can edit them specifically. Unmarking and deselecting by double-clicking Existing "markers" or "selections" can be removed simply by double-clicking. This makes it easier for you to remove markers and selections, as there is no need to go through the menu. Edit marked articles Extras->Sonstiges->Markierte Artikel bearbeiten allows you to make mass changes to certain data for all selected items. Further functions have been added here and the menu entries are now sorted alphabetically. The following article data can now also be edited in bulk: Anzahl der Nachkommastellen für den Artikelbestand MwSt-Schlüssel von Artikel Beschaffungszeit von Artikel (in Tage) Die Mengeneinheit von Artikel (z.B. "kg" oder "cm")' New mass change functions. Change in mass of the unit of measure. Mass change of decimal places. Mass change in procurement time. Mass change of the MwSt. key.

title: Process exported addresses from Cowis
text: In this article you learned how to export addresses. How to export addresses from Cowis.Net If you navigate to the file location using Windows File Explorer, you will find the export file created internally. This file is a TXT file. If you open this file with an editor it will probably look like this. Click on the image to enlarge it The individual data fields are separated with , and the content of the data fields is enclosed in " ". You'll probably want to open the data in Excel or another spreadsheet program. Since these programs are not supported by support, you have to take care of importing the data yourself. Alternatively, you can order an import outside the SLA for a fee. Please note that an appointment is required for this. What you can expect from support.

title: Reprint all processes of a customer
text: Reprint all processes of a customer Sometimes a customer would like to receive delivery bills, invoices or credit notes from a certain period again, for example. Here you go to Orders in Cowis Backoffice Start a selection by mask (single transaction) Then select the desired transactions, the date range, the address ID or other possible selection criteria. Then mark the selection result and go to Print -> Data record Set the printout mask according to your wishes and the printouts are then output

title: Selektion
text: Inhaltsverzeichnis 3.7.1 Selektion (Filtern) 3.7.2 Erkennen einer aktiven Selektion 3.7.3 Formulieren einer Selektion 3.7.4 Aufheben einer Selektion 3.7.5 Selektionsfelder 3.7.6 Funktionen der Selektionsfelder 3.7.7 Sonderzeichen bei Selektionen 3.7.8 Selektionen verketten 3.7.9 Beispiele für Selektionen 3.7.1 Selektion (Filtern) Im Laufe der Zeit „sammeln“ sich im Artikelstamm eine Vielzahl von Artikeln an. Dann wird es immer häufiger vorkommen, dass Sie nicht mehr mit allen Artikeln arbeiten wollen, sondern nur noch mit einer bestimmten Auswahl. Das ist das Einsatzgebiet von Filtern oder wie diese in DdD Cowis backoffice bezeichnet werden, einer Selektion. Bei einer Selektion können Sie selbst entscheiden, welche Artikel angezeigt werden und welche nicht. Dazu müssen Sie Bedingungen formulieren, die Artikel erfüllen müssen um in dieser Selektion angezeigt zu werden. Aber keine Angst – das ist viel einfacher als Sie denken. 3.7.2 Erkennen einer aktiven Selektion An dem roten Rechteck mit dem Vermerk „Sel.“ in der Statuszeile erkennen Sie, dass eine Selektion aktiv ist. 3.7.3 Formulieren einer Selektion Starten Sie durch einen Klick auf oder durch drücken der F3 Taste. Es erscheint der folgende Dialog: In diesem Dialog geben Sie jetzt die Bedingungen der Artikel ein, die nach der Selektion angezeigt werden sollen. Wenn Sie eine Selektionsmaske speichern möchten, müssen Sie erst den gewünschten Namen der Maske eintragen, dann die Selektionskritierien und anschließend ausführen. Achten Sie hierbei auf genau diese Reihenfolge, da sonst Ihre Eingaben verworfen werden. Um nach einer Artikeleigenschaft zu selektieren, klicken Sie in das angegebene Feld und wählen Ihre Artikel-Eigenschaft und den dazugehörigen Wert aus. Artikel-Eigenschaften in der Selektion eintragen Um einen Eintrag zu löschen, klicken Sie mit der rechten Maustaste auf die gewünschte Zeile. 3.7.4 Aufheben einer Selektion Eine Selektion bleibt solange aktiv, bis Sie diese wieder aufheben oder DdD Cowis backoffice beenden. Sie heben eine Selektion auf, indem Sie eine „leere“ Selektion formulieren – also durch anklicken von oder durch drücken der F3 Taste. Den Selektionsdialog beenden Sie dann durch einen Klick auf oder mit der F2 Taste. 3.7.5 Selektionsfelder In der nachfolgenden Tabelle werden die Funktionen der Selektionsfelder beschrieben. In den Feldern mit freier Eingabe können mehrere Werte, jeweils durch Komma getrennt, eingegeben werden. Dabei erfüllt ein Artikel die Bedingungen bereits dann, wenn einer der eingetragenen Werte der Selektion auf den Artikel passt. Man spricht hier von einer „ODER-Bedingung“. Ein Artikel muss eine „ODER“ die andere Bedingung erfüllen. Die Werte der einzelnen Selektionsfelder stellen eine so genannte „UND-Bedingung“ dar. Das bedeutet, dass ein Artikel der angezeigt werden soll, die Bedingung des ersten Feldes „UND“ die Bedingung des zweiten Feldes usw. erfüllen muss. Sie können mehrere Einträge nacheinander aus den Vorschlagslisten auswählen. DdD Cowis backoffice fügt die Einträge dann automatisch durch Komma getrennt in das jeweilige Selektionsfeld ein. 3.7.6 Funktionen der Selektionsfelder Selektionsfeld Hinweis Letzter WE Schränkt das Ergebnis auf die Artikel ein, deren letzte Lieferung innerhalb des eingegebenen Zeitraumes liegt. Artikel-ID Die eingegebene Zeichenfolge muss genau entsprechend sein, Sonderzeichen und Wildcards erlaubt. Warengruppe Lieferant Bestell-Nr. Die eingegebene Zeichenfolge muss enthalten sein, gleichgültig am Anfang, am Ende oder innerhalb der Bestellnummer. Saison Die eingegebene Zeichenfolge muss genau entsprechend sein, Sonderzeichen und Wildcards erlaubt. Stichwortfelder Verkäufe zw. Schränkt das Ergebnis auf die Artikel ein, deren letzter Verkauf innerhalb des eingegebenen Zeitraumes liegt. Markierung "J“: nur markierte Artikel werden berücksichtigt. “N“: nur nicht markierte Artikel werden berücksichtigt. Bezeichnung Die eingegebene Zeichenfolge muss enthalten sein, gleichgültig ob am Anfang oder innerhalb der Bezeichnung. 3.7.7 Sonderzeichen bei Selektionen Bei den meisten Feldern gibt es bestimmte Zeichen mit Sonderfunktionen. Diese Sonderzeichen bezeichnet man als Wildcards oder Jokerzeichen. Sonderzeichen Funktion , Trennt verschiedene Werte voneinander. Bei der Selektion gilt für durch Komma getrennte Werte die UND-Funktion. ? Ein beliebiges Zeichen. * Beliebig viele (aber auch kein) beliebige Zeichen. Beispielsweise bedeutet Warengruppe: 1*: „jeder Wert, der mit einer 1 beginnt, erfüllt die Selektionsbedingung“. .. Bereich z.B. für Warengruppen. Die Zeichenfolge 100..199 bedeutet: „Jeder Wert zwischen 100 und 199 erfüllt die Selektionsbedingung“. % Ausschluss: Dieser Wert darf nicht vorkommen. z.B. Warengruppe: %100 bedeutet „alle Warengruppen außer 100“. Aus diesen Sonderzeichen lassen sich folgende Kombinationen formulieren: ?* Ein „nicht leeres“ Feld. In dem Feld muss irgendein Wert stehen, es ist aber gleichgültig welcher. z.B. Warengruppe: ?* bedeutet: „alle Artikel, bei denen das Feld Warengruppe nicht leer ist, erfüllen die Selektion“. %?* Ein leeres Feld. Das Feld muss leer sein. z.B. Warengruppe: %?* bedeutet: „alle Artikel, bei denen das Feld Warengruppe leer ist, erfüllen die Selektion“. 1*,%120 Alle Werte, die mit einer 1 beginnen, außer dem Wert 120 erfüllen, die Selektion. 3.7.8 Selektionen verketten Wenn Sie eine Selektion formuliert haben und möchten auf die so erhaltene Selektionsmenge nochmals eine Selektion anwenden, so ist das so direkt nicht möglich. Denn mit dem Start einer neuen Selektion wird die eventuell aktive Selektion aufgehoben. Aber es gibt einen kleinen Trick um diese Funktion trotzdem nutzen zu können. Gehen Sie bitte wie folgt vor: 1. Formulieren Sie Ihre erste Selektion wie gewohnt. 2. Markieren Sie die selektierten Datensätze. 3. Nutzen Sie dazu die Menüfunktion „Datensatz – markieren – alles markieren“. 4. Die selektierten Datensätze werden blau dargestellt 5. Formulieren Sie jetzt die 2. Selektionsbedingung und ergänzen Sie die Bedingung der 2. Selektion um die Bedingung „Markierung“ = „J“. 3.7.9 Beispiele für Selektionen Alle Artikel des Lieferanten „Carhartt“ (und NUR dieses Lieferanten) erfüllen die Selektion. Alle Artikel der Warengruppe 100 (=Jeans) erfüllen die Selektion. Alle Artikel der Lieferanten „CARHARTT“ oder „SOLIVER“ erfüllen die Selektion. Alle Hosen die zu einer Warengruppe gehörten, die mit 1 beginnt (100 = Jeans, 110 = Damenhosen, 120 = Herrenhosen, 190 = Shorts) UND die vom Lieferanten Carhartt stammen. Selektion nach Wareneingangsnummer Wählen Sie in der Selektionsmaske (F3) im neuen Feld "Wareneingangsnummer" einen Wareneingang aus, erhalten Sie als Selektionsergebnis alle Artikel, die in diesem Wareneingang geliefert wurden. Artikelselektion

title: How do I help myself if the data exchange between Cowiskasse and Cowis.Net back office "hangs"
text: Normally, data exchange or remote data transmission (or dial-up for short) works smoothly. If there is a problem with the dial-up, you should try to help yourself. First you need to know the type of dial-up, there is file dial-up and remote dial-up. If you go to cash balances in the Cowis back office, you will see the indication of the type of data entry in blue at the top right. If Remote Dial-up is displayed at X checkout, contact support. If File Dial-Up is at X checkout, try the following steps: Run “Lost Dial-up Packages” in Cowis.Net Backoffice - Extras -> Lost dial-up packages The data transmission packets that have not yet been acknowledged are then processed again. The data packages now have to be sent to the cash register; there is either a batch file for this or the data is sent directly to the cash register. If you are unsure how the data gets to the checkout, contact support. At the Cowiskasse you can now read the packages via Function -> Data -> Data exchange. Then press “Lost Dial-up Packages” on the Cowiskasse. Once the data has been transferred and read into Cowis.Net, the data transmission should work again.

title: Is it possible to search/find receipts in Cowis?
text: No, only in the POS, but the journal for the corresponding day can be viewed in the Cowis Back Office system. To do this, go to the Cash register transactions area and select the desired item. Drucken->Spezielles->Journal:

title: What does “mask” mean? And how does it work.
text: In all Cowis.Net Backoffice program items you will find the term “mask” either in selections or in evaluations. In the article area within the selection Address area within the selection Let's assume you want to repeatedly select addresses of customers with an email address and in a specific zip code area in the address area. Then you can either make these settings every time, or you can put on a mask. Due to the GDPR, the customer data in the screenshot is anonymized, i.e. the postal code does not correspond to the one you know it. As a result, you will receive a number of customers with email addresses and from the zip code area. Without a mask, you have to enter this field again each time you make a new selection using the same criteria. If, before you carry out the selected selection for the first time, you enter a name that is plausible for you in the empty "Mask" field (e.g. "Ku-ZIP-Mail") and then carry out the selection, the fields you saved will be included in the Mask adopted. Now you can access the selection criteria you saved at any time using the drop-down menu under “Mask” without having to think about what the settings were last time. The field for this is “Mask”.

title: Rename site
text: Der Name bzw. die Bezeichnung einer Filiale lässt sich in der Warenwirtschaft wie folgt ändern: Artikelbereich -> Datei -> Filialen Filiale anklicken -> Ändern -> Bezeichnung ändern -> OK

title: How can you create payment methods?
text: To create payment methods for the cash register, go to Cowi's back office in System -> Parameters -> Payment methods As is usual in the Cowis.Net back office, you can create a new payment method with F5 or New Meaning of the individual fields: Name: Name of the payment method displayed at the checkout (max. 10 characters) Sorting: Where in the payment method list at the checkout the payment method appears Display: whether the payment method should even be displayed at the checkout Sales: defines whether the payment method at the checkout generates sales or not Bank: Whether the payment method can be used for bank deposits, usually only cash, i.e. euros or possible foreign currencies such as CHF (Swiss francs) Account number: If another account should be addressed instead of the general account in the transfer to financial accounting (usually not used) Telecash: Whether the payment method should be transferred to a PT (pay terminal) connected to the checkout Withdrawal: Whether payment should be possible using this payment method in the event of an exchange. Usually cash and voucher, sometimes handover to a PT

title: Update der Warenwirtschaft
text: Inhaltsverzeichnis Vorbereitung des Update Installation des Updates für DdD Cowis backoffice Installation des Updates für die DdD Cowis pos Vorbereitung des Updates Ein Update nimmt tief greifende Änderungen an der Datenstruktur von DdD Cowis backoffice vor. Daher sollten Sie folgende Punkte vor dem Einlesen des Updates sicherstellen: DdD Cowis backoffice Server Update Führen Sie das Update immer an dem Server durch, auf dem sich die Installation befindet. Virenscanner sind hierbei für den Zeitraum der Installation zu deaktivieren. Benutzer abmelden & Programme schließen Alle geöffneten DdD Cowis backoffice müssen geschlossen werden. Ale DdD Cowis backoffice Services wie „Remote-Service“ oder „Business-Service“ müssen gestoppt und beendet werden. Kontrolle der angemeldeten Benutzer in DdD Cowis backoffice Kontrollieren Sie die angemeldeten Benutzer über: Service Informationen (in der Anmeldemaske)\Benutzer\Angemeldete Benutzer Derzeit angemeldete Benutzer Angemeldete Benutzer beenden Sollten weitere Benutzer in DdD Cowis backoffice angemeldet sein, beenden Sie DdD Cowis backoffice an diesen Arbeitsplätzen. Wenn in der „Übersicht der angemeldeten Benutzer“ noch Benutzer aufgelistet werden, die Ihr Cowis bereits beendet haben, diese jedoch hier noch aufgeführt werden, fahren Sie den aufgeführten PC-Arbeitsplatz herunter. Die Aufgabenplanung in Windows prüfen Sollten Sie DdD Cowis backoffice Services automatisch in Windows starten, müssen Sie diese zuvor beendet werden. Dies können Sie unter Windows 7 & Windows Server 2008 über die „Aufgabenplanung“. Bei älteren Betriebsystemen wie Windows XP oder auch Windows Server 2003 über den „Taskplaner“. Zu den automatischen Aufgaben gehören: COWIS_Datensicherung COWIS_Datenaustausch_EDI COWIS_Datenaustausch_EShop COWIS_Datenaustausch_Kassen COWIS_Business_Service Aufruf der Aufgabenplanung unter Windows 7 Aufgabenplanung Datensicherung Zur Datensicherung der Datenbank klicken Sie bitte auf die entsprechenden Menüpunkte: System\Datensicherung\Datensicherung Hiermit werden alle Daten in einer Datei im Verzeichnis „L:\Cowis.net\Backup“ gesichert. Datensicherung aufrufen Installation des Updates für DdD Cowis pos Starten des Update Vorgangs Im Hauptmenü als Benutzer anmelden. Den Navigations-Punkt „System“ anklicken. System-Bereich aufrufen Wählen Sie dann den Menüpunkt „Update/Update online einlesen“ aus. Update online einlesen Klicken Sie im Anschluss auf den Button „Start“. "Start" des Updates Download des Updates Das Update wird nun vom Updateserver heruntergeladen. Wenn es hier zu keiner Verbindung kommt, prüfen Sie bitte Ihre Internetverbindung und Ihre Firewall- Einstellungen. Update der Programmversion einspielen Wenn der Downloadvorgang abgeschlossen ist, erhalten Sie nachfolgende Meldung, die Sie bitte mit „OK“ bestätigen müssen. Programmaktualisierung erfolgreich Update der Datenbank einspielen Starten Sie nun DdD Cowis backoffice neu. Melden Sie sich mit Ihrem Benutzer an Sie erhalten eine Hinweismeldung, das die Datenbank gewisse Updatesteps nun durchführen wird. Bestätigen Sie die folgende Meldung bitte mit „Ja“. Datenbank-Updatestep - Hinweis Kontrolle der aktuellen Version Das Einlesen des Updates ist nun beendet. Bitte kontrollieren Sie die Version unter dem Menüpunkt „Service-Informationen“ in der Hauptmaske. Services in der Aufgabenplanung wieder starten Nach dem erfolgreichen Update können alle beendeten Dienste (Status: „Bereit“) wieder über Ausführen gestartet werden (Status: „Wird ausgeführt“). Sollten Sie dies nicht machen, werden die Dienste automatisch erst zum nächsten Startzeitpunkt ausgeführt. Update im mobilen DdD COWIS backoffice Sollten Sie ein mobiles DdD Cowis backoffice haben, müssen Sie unbedingt auch hier das Update Online herunterladen. Installation des Updates für die DdD Cowis pos Datenaustausch über Datei-DFÜ Dieses wird automatisch in die Datenaustausch-Verzeichnisse der Kassen kopiert (z.B. \\Server\Cowis.net\K0001\Transmit“). Nach dem nächsten Datenaustausch wird dieses Update an die Kassen übertragen. Nach dem nächsten Neustart des Kassenprogramms erhalten Sie einen Hinweis auf das aktuelle Update. Die Kasse liest das Update ein, sobald Sie auf „Update“ klicken. Datenaustausch über den „Remote-Service“ Hier müssen Sie nichts weiter beachten. Das Update wird automatisch übertragen. Nach dem nächsten Neustart des Kassenprogramms erhalten Sie einen Hinweis auf das aktuelle Update. Die Kasse liest das Update ein, sobald Sie auf „Update“ klicken. Update-Hinweis an der Kasse Wenn das Update erfolgreich eingelesen werden konnte erhalten Sie einen entsprechenden Hinweis. Das Programm startet sich dann automatisch neu. Nach dem Neustart der DdD Cowis pos können Sie wie gewohnt weiter arbeiten.

title: How to add a user to Cowis Back Office
text: Loggen Sie sich mit dem Benutzer "Chef" in die Warenwirtschaft ein und folgen Sie folgendem Klickpfac: System->Benutzer->Benutzerpflege-> hier sieht man eine Übersicht aller angelegten Benutzer Am einfachsten ist es wenn Sie einen bereits bestehenden Benutzer kopieren: Bestehenden Benutzer anklicken->kopieren->Benutzername eintippen->Bemerkung falls gewünscht eintragen Benutzer "Chef" hat die Benutzerstufe 4 und kann daher nur Benutzer anlegen die eine kleinere Stufe als er haben. 4 ist die höchste Benutzerstufe die Sie haben können und 3 die höchste die Sie vergeben können. Wählen Sie anschliessend aus was der Benutzer in Cowis dürfen können muss Klicken Sie anschliessend 3 Mal auf "Ok" Ein Passwort für einen Benutzer kann nur vom/im Benutzer selbst vergeben werden. Das geht dann im Einloggfenster vom Hauptmen über über "Passwort ändern"

title: How can I change texts on the receipt
text: To change the information on the Cowiskasse receipt such as street, postal code, go to the Cowis.Net back office - Cash statements - file - Cash register parameters Then you have a “Search” field at the bottom, where you enter TEXT All parameters that contain the word “text” will be displayed. You are now looking in the parameters "KaDpTextObenX" (x stands for 1-6) for the parameters for the street, zip code, city, telephone number that need to be changed. Then click on the corresponding parameter and can then change the value for the corresponding cash register number on the right-hand side (you must know the cash register number) Then go to Apply and you can change other parameters if necessary. But you MUST also change the corresponding parameters for the TSE. To do this, look at the bottom of the list of parameters that you searched for with TXT; for example, it says "TseEigeneStrasse". The change must then be made in the same way as for the “normal” printing parameter.

title: Customer-specific prices
text: So können Sie einem Artikel einen kundenspezifischen Preis hinterlegen: 1. Öffnen Sie den Artikelbereich in der Warenwirtschaft und klicken Sie anschliessend auf "Einstellungen"->"Alle"->"Aufträge" 2. Setzen Sie den Haken bei "kundenspezifische Artikelpreise (Preisvereinbarungen)" und bestätigen Sie anschliessend mit "OK". Falls der Haken bereits gesetzt ist, drücken Sie einfach nur auf "OK" 3. Gehen Sie anschliessend über das Hauptmenü in den Artikelbereich und klicken Sie den Artikel, für den Sie einen kundenspezifischen Preis anlegen möchten, einmal an, sodass dieser rot hinterlegt ist. 4. Klicken Sie anschliessend auf "Extras"->"Buchen / Priese bearbeiten"->"Preisvereinbarung mit Kunde" 5. Durch klicken auf "Neu" können Sie einen Kunden auswählen und diesem den gewünschten Preis hinterlegen. 6. Bestätigen Sie die Konfiguration indem Sie auf "OK" klicken.

title: How to view the TSE serial number
text: You can find the TSE serial numbers of your cash registers in the Warenwirtschaft via : Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras ->Sonstiges -> TSE Fiskaly Info

title: How can you use multiple GLNs with one supplier?
text: Go to the address of the relevant supplier using Change Go to Edit on the contact page In the window that opens, go to New Enter a description and the GLN Now incoming EDI messages with different GLNs are assigned to a supplier

title: Meaning of a * in the Status column in the cash register closings (exception log)
text: The * in the Status column indicates that the user has viewed/printed the exception log for the relevant daily closing. (see also parameter "AusnProtPosGeloescht") The exception log is called up in the cash register closings area via Print -> Evaluations -> Exception log The exception log lists everything that by definition represents an exception to regular sales. This includes - Sales with zero inventory - Price reductions - Exchanges - Zero receipts - Issue receipts - Line and receipt breaks What is the exception log needed for? If an employee causes a lot of exceptions, such as line or receipt breaks, or unusually high price reductions, this can be a clue for an employee meeting. It is NOT the job of support to make assumptions about WHY an employee causes exceptions, support is only there to show the user how to create the exception log, interpretation is always a matter for the user. Examples of exception protocols f

title: Create items with reduced VAT
text: By default, Cowis.Net is set up for items with the standard VAT rate. However, if a user also has items with a reduced tax rate, you must check whether the necessary setting has been made. At first glance, this can be checked in the item master data: If this field is visible in the item master data, then everything is correct and the user can select the VAT rate when creating the item. If this feature is missing in the item master data, you must activate the display. In the Cowis.Net back office, go to System Parameters General settings There you activate the check box for "Display VAT rate field" Save this by clicking OK, leave the system area and can now select the desired VAT rate when creating the item. (It is important that you do not enter 19 and 7 as numbers, but 1 and 2)

title: Overview of open vouchers
text: The list of open vouchers is created in Cowis.Net Backoffice. You navigate to the Cash register closings area Go to Print Special Overview of open vouchers

title: Export voucher list
text: To export a list of vouchers to Excel, for example, proceed as follows: In the Cowis.Net back office, navigate to Cash register closings You go to File Vouchers Our recommendation is: select ALL VOUCHERS The reason for this is simple: For "open vouchers", the original value is always exported, even if part of it has already been redeemed. For open vouchers, both the original amount, the amount that may already have been redeemed and the amount that is still outstanding are exported. We recommend the following setting: Then go to Print -> Excel Export You will receive the following window and click OK MS Excel will open and you will receive a message You click YES and you will receive vouchers in Excel

title: What is Hamachi and why can't support help you here?
text: If you have branches with Cowis cash registers that are not on the same network as your Cowis.Net inventory management system, the data must be transferred from and to the cash registers. For external branches, a so-called VPN (virtual private network) is required. The customer (i.e. you) must provide this VPN. In the past, it may have happened that due to the customer not having a hardware partner, Cowis Support presented you with an alternative option and possibly installed and set it up. This was the "Hamachi" software (Logmein). Cowis Support bears no responsibility for this software, cannot support it and cannot help with problems. If you would like to use Cowis Support's help for this 3rd party software, this is a paid service. We recommend that you have a VPN set up by a local hardware or software partner.

title: Find EAN Code for an item
text: There are two solutions: 1. Under Inventory (Inventur), you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID. 2. You can export a Dat-file from Cowis, where you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID.: 1. Choose where to save the file and what to name it. Click on the three dots to rename the file. 2. Choose Artikel to get alle information of the articles 3. Highlight all the articles you need (you can also choose to highlight only one article) 4. Tick nterne EAN-Codes exportieren 5. Click OK The Dat-file will be saved in the desired location. You can now import it into Excel to see the EAN Codes.

title: Enter payment in order processing
text: When you call up the menu item "Extras / Enter payments", DdD Cowis shows you the outstanding amount of the invoices in the "Payments" window. This display refers to the complete transaction you are on when you call up the menu item. If you press the [F5] key here, you will receive a selection list in which all invoices for this complete transaction are listed. When you confirm an invoice, it is transferred to the "Payments" window. If the invoice amount was not paid in full immediately, you can correct the amount if necessary. The remaining amount is then displayed in the "still outstanding" field. If the invoice is within the discount period, DdD Cowis will inform you of this when you select the invoice and you can use the "Yes / No" button to grant a discount or not. For complete transactions for which there is also a credit note, you will be asked whether the invoice should be offset against the credit note or not when you select the invoice. If you answer this question with "Yes", you must select the corresponding credit note from the selection list and confirm it. You must then enter the remaining amount of the invoice as a payment receipt.

title: transfer a backup for our development
text: sind Sie bitte so gut und senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung, damit die Entwicklung direkt mit Ihren Parametern und Einstellungen schauen kann. So senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung: Sie öffnen mit einem Internetbrowser diesen Link Transfer Now (https://www.transfernow.net/de) Nachdem Sie auf Start geklickt haben Navigieren Sie in Ihrem Windows Explorer zum Verzeichnis (Ordner) Backup innerhalb Ihres Cowis.Net Verzeichnisses, im Regelfall L:\Cowis.Net\Backup Hier wählen Sie dann das letzte (aktuellste) Backup aus, dies sollte das Datum vor dem heutigen Tag tragen Hier tragen Sie Ihre E-Mail Adresse ein Geben Ihren Absendernamen ein Klicken Sie anschließend auf das Schloss-Symbol (Im Screenshot rot eingekreist). Tragen Sie ein Passwort ein und klicken Sie auf "Bestätigen": Bei E-Mail des Empfängers tragen Sie bitte ein: Igor.Kyselov@k3btg.com Bei Betreff können Sie eintragen: Ihre Firmenname und Datensicherung Cowis Nachricht ist optional Dann klicken Sie auf Übertragen Wir erhalten dadurch eine Möglichkeit Ihre Datensicherung zu nutzen um das von Ihnen geschilderte Anliegen schneller und mit Ihren Daten zu analysieren Bitte teilen Sie uns das Passwort, das Sie in Transfernow eingetragen, als Antwort auf diese Nachricht mit. Sobald wir die Datei von Transfernow heruntergeladen haben, bekommen Sie eine E-Mail hierzu. Bitte löschen Sie die Datei anschliessend von Transfernow. Wir melden uns dann mit einem Ergebnis / Lösung

title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them

title: Time recording - correction - manual recording
text: If the working hours have been recorded in the Cowiskasse, they are transferred to the Cowis.Net back office via data exchange. The working hours can be found in the area "Cash register closings" -> File -> Time recording In this area it is possible to make corrections, delete entries or add them manually. (To what extent this is permissible under working hour law, please ask a legal advisor) Correct entry Select the entry to be corrected with a click and then select Change (or F7) The employee in this example has a verifiable start time of 7:55 a.m., so we change the 1st arrival entry of the day to the correct time. After you have selected Change (or F7), press Enter until you are in the TIME cell and change the entry to the correct time. Press Enter or save the entry with F2 or by clicking Save When the entry has been saved, #### appears in the booking type, this is a hint for the user to make a manual change. (You may need to adjust the cell width) You can also delete entries, select the entry to be deleted and use the F8 or Delete key. Enter entry If, for whatever reason, you are forced to enter an entry manually, proceed as follows. Select NEW (or F5) An empty line is created with the starting position on the personnel number Either you know the employee number or you use the drop-down function or press F9 (that stands for list) In this example, we only have 2 employees We now enter working hours for Mr. Völkner on October 29, 2024 from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with a break from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. A total of 4 entries are required for this We select the seller and press Enter The initial approach is that Cowis.Net suggests "Go". As this makes no sense for the first booking, it is important for you to know that you can ONLY select the booking type using F9 or the drop-down menu. (Manually entering the word "Come" or "Go" has NO effect) So we select "Come" for Mr. Völkner We enter the date in the time-saving Cowis way with DDMM (without points and in the same year without a year, i.e. 2910) and press Enter We enter the time in the format HH:MM and press Enter Cowis.Net Office asks Create another data record (YES / No) We select YES and create the next data record, the start of the break We select the employee with the personnel number 1 again and press Enter Mr. Völkner went on break on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00, so we record a departure on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00 and when we press Enter Cowis.Net Backoffice asks whether the next data record should be recorded. We confirm this with Yes and then record the return from the break at 13:00 And to complete this manual recording, we record the final departure at 18:00 At the end of the manual recording, you have 4 entries (2 arrivals and 2 departures) And if you are unsure: do not hesitate to ask about a paid training course.

title: Time recording - evaluation - analysis
text: After you have recorded the working hours, the evaluation takes place. The evaluation of the time recording can either be done via the evaluations, or (which makes more sense) in the cash register closings (the evaluation is the same in both cases) We go into cash register closings Go to Print -> Evaluations -> Time recording You enter the date from - to and can go straight to OK without further ado The result is an overview list of all employees and their recorded working hours (In this example, only 2 days of 1 employee are recorded, we zoom in a bit) The times shown are net (i.e. breaks have already been deducted) The second option for the evaluation is the detailed evaluation per employee To do this, select in the "Print variant" field -> Individual salesperson. You will only see employees for whom working hours have been recorded This evaluation then looks like this If you have any questions or are unsure, please feel free to take advantage of our paid training offer.

title: Selection by branches in the cash register closings
text: Previously (Cowis.Net version 6.4.60 before November 5, 2024) in the Cowis.Net back office cash register closings there was only the option of displaying all branches or selecting a specific branch from the drop-down menu of the quick filter. Sometimes it happened that users entered several branches separated by commas in order to filter. This led to the problem that the cash register closings program area could no longer be opened afterwards. From the Cowis.Net back office program version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024 or later, it is possible to select several branches by activating checkboxes in the cash register closings area.

title: Export articles
text: You can export articles in Cowis.Net. This creates an "ArtExp.dat" file which you can then import into Excel, for example. We do not offer any support beyond creating the export file. You mark the articles you want to export in the Articles section. Then you go to System via Area Once you get there, go to Service -> Master data import/export -> Standard import/export There, switch to the "Export" tab Select the type of export -> activate the checkboxes you want to export and click OK The file is then saved in the selected target directory When opened with an editor, the file looks like this: Imported into Excel like this

title: Start of the notification obligation according to Section 146a Paragraph 4 of the Fiscal Code (AO) (TSE notification)
text: Dear customers When setting up the TSE, you were made aware that you have to register the cash registers with your responsible tax office. Depending on the federal state, you (or your tax advisor) received the information: this is not yet possible. In a letter dated June 28, 2024 from the BMF (Federal Ministry of Finance) to the highest financial authorities of the states (see link) Schreiben des BMF 28.06.2024 it is announced that electronic transmission will be made available from January 1, 2025. We, DdD retail Germany GmbH, are not responsible for reporting your cash registers to your tax office (to the best of our knowledge). The information you need to report your cash registers can be found in Cowis.Net Backoffice Cash register closings Extras -> other -> TSE Fiskaly Info Of course, your TSE info looks different Your tax advisor or your responsible tax office will tell you what to do with this information.

title: Overview of open selections
text: Printing a list of open selections Cash closings Printing Special Overview of open selections Result

title: Create a list of open items (unpaid invoices)
text: To create an overview of unpaid invoices/credit notes, proceed as follows: Orders Select unpaid invoices/credit notes Entweder F3 oder das Icon für Selektion wählen unpaid invoices/credit notes The result of the selection is a list of all unpaid invoices/credit notes Mark all entries or only mark the desired entries Print List By entering the desired print length in the desired print fields, you define the layout of your list The result is a list of unpaid invoices/credit notes

title: Add a password to a shop assistant
text: Sign into Backoffice with a user with administrator rights. Click Adressen To sort the selection to only show shop assistants (employees), click Datensatz, then Selektion: Click on Mitarbeiter, select Ja and OK The overview now only shows employees. Click on the employee you wish to add a password to and click Ändern. Click Ändern to open for changes, click the tab called Mitarbeiter and adde a password to Verkäufer-Password, then click Speichern. Repeat this for every employee you wish to add a password to. Once done, it will automatically transfer to the POS with the next dataexchange.

title: Reset sales figures
text: Normally all sales figures are always displayed in Cowis.Net Backoffice. See screenshot There is a function in Cowis.Net Backoffice "Reset sales" (Article -> Extras -> Other -> Reset sales This resets the sales figures in the inventory management system. This does NOT mean that any turnover or sales are deleted, it is ONLY a "zeroing" of the sales figures displayed in the items area When you execute this function, you will be asked whether all articles or only the marked articles should be edited The number of sales from the day of the reset is then zero. This means that if you execute this function on March 6, 2025, you will see that the sales section is empty. Of course, all the sales figures are still there in the history and the evaluations. If you now go back to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can click on Total Sales Figures dann werden wieder alle seit Anbeginn verkauften Teile angezeigt If you go again to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can see that you can "switch on" that ONLY the sales figures since the date of the reset are displayed Why should So how do you reset sales? Some customers reset their sales figures on January 1st of each year so they can see what their current sales are, that's the only reason why you do it on schedule.

title: Recalculate Order Backlog
text: If incorrect order backlog figures are displayed in the Items section, you can try to restore consistency by performing a check and correcting them. In the Cowis.Net back office, go to Items Extras Other Recalculate Order Backlog At the very bottom of the window, you'll see what Cowis.Net is currently doing. You may receive various pop-up messages (as in this example). Confirm by clicking OK. If the footer no longer displays anything, the consistency check is complete, and your order backlog should be correct. If not, please don't hesitate to create a ticket via the support portal.

title: Recreating Receipt of Goods
text: If you have accidentally deleted a receipt of goods, you can recreate it by following these steps: First contact Support to get the daily password for Cowis. Log into your Backoffice Choose Service Choose Service -> Zugriffslisten -> Order Enter the Password you got from Cowis Support. Choose Wareneingang and OK Locate the delted receipt of goods, remove the tick and click OK. Now the receipt of goods has been restored and you can process it.

title: Abrechnungszeitraum erstellen Anleitung (Kassenbuchung)
text: ->B 1. Cowis->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten Entsprechende Kasse auswählen und mit "OK" bestätigen -> anschließend öffnet sich die Übersicht der Abrechnungszeiträume "Neu"->Name für den Zeitraum eintragen->"Von" und "bis" eintragen (Optimalerweise 1 Monat)->Solange "Enter"-Taste drücken bis "Weiteren Datensatz anlegen?" erscheint->mit "Nein" beantworten Doppelklick auf den erstellten Zeitraum und im anschließenden Pop-up Fenster "Ja" klicken Die Belege werden nun bearbeitet, was sich auch in der Zeile unten einsehen lässt. Dies kann einige Minuten dauern. Nach abgeschlossener Bearbeitung öffnet sich ein Fenster->"Zurück" klicken Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok->Ja Abrechnungsnummer bestätigen Druckvorschau schließen "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken" UNBEDINGT mit "Ja" beantworten. Ansonsten muss der Abrechnungszeitraum durch uns freigegeben werden.
